review.title: Building Smart Communities with Cyber-Physical Systems
review.abstract: There is a growing trend towards the convergence of cyber-physical systems (CPS) and social computing, which will lead to the emergence of smart communities composed of various objects (including both human individuals and physical things) that interact and cooperate with each other. These smart communities promise to enable a number of innovative applications and services that will improve the quality of life. This position paper addresses some opportunities and challenges of building smart communities characterized by cyber-physical and social intelligence.

sections.heading: VISION OF SMART COMMUNITY
sections.text: It is our vision that smart communities based on CPS and social networking services will be ubiquitous. Smart communities will be an integral part of our society of the future and offer a promising solution to many problems at the societal level. Besides the individual, social things will become essential elements of intelligent communities. In an intelligent community, various social objects, both human and physical things, will interact via ubiquitous networks and provide ubiquitous services through the exploration of virtual-physical and social intelligence.

sections.heading: Why Smart Community?
sections.text: There are a number of important drivers for building new communities, among which we mentioned the following three. • Our society faces many critical challenges that need to be addressed. • One of the biggest challenges is the unprecedented ageing of the population, with its inevitable impact on quality of life. • The most important societal challenges are that people live longer and have more time for themselves. • The transport networks of many modern cities are saturated, disabled or chronically ill.

sections.heading: Community and Online Community
sections.text: Although there are many different forms of communities, they are undoubtedly indispensable to man. Without community there would be no life. As a general understanding (according to Wikipedia), a community can be described as a group of interacting people. Often, the group shares some common values, characteristics or interests and is associated with social cohesion. Unlike real-life communities, an online community is a virtual community that exists online. Members are a group of people who communicate or interact with each other using information technology, typically via the Internet and not in person. Social networking services consist of one of the most representative types of online communities. In the information age, online communities have become an important form of social interaction between the majority of people.

sections.heading: SUMMARY
sections.text: In this position paper, we outline our vision of smart communities, with which a paradigm shift in IT is planned, in which the virtual, physical and social worlds will converge. Smart communities will build on recent technological advances in both CPS and social computing. We argue that the importance of the role that smart communities will play in our society cannot be overstated, and in particular, smart communities will help address emerging societal challenges in ways that were impossible a few years ago. However, multidisciplinary studies need to be undertaken to address the challenges of building smart communities, and we look forward to extensive efforts in this direction.
